name: src/api/arithmetic/add/add.js
add
description:
Adds two big endian arrays and puts result in a destination array.
Wraps on overflow. Works with any combination of array sizes.

name: src/api/arithmetic/add/iadd.js
iadd
description:
Adds a big endian array to another ___in-place___.
Wraps on overflow. Works with any combination of array sizes.

name: src/api/arithmetic/add/increment.js
increment
description:
Adds 1 to a big endian array.

Wraps on overflow. Hence, does nothing if aj <= ai.

O(|A|) time in the worst case.
O(1) amortized time over any number of successive operations starting with A = O(1).
O(1) amortized time over O(|A|) successive operations starting with any A.

name: src/api/arithmetic/div/_divmod.js
content:
import _copy from '../../../core/array/_copy.js';
import _idivmod from './_idivmod.js';

/**
 * Computes the quotient and remainder of two numbers. Uses the most
 * appropriate algorithms depending on the size of the operands. The remainder
 * is written to the dividend array. There are a few assumptions made on the
 * input.
 *
 * Input
 * -----
 *  - No leading zeros in D or Q.
 *  - |D| = |Q| = |R|
 *
 * @param {Number} r The base to work with.
 * @param {Array} D Dividend array.
 * @param {Number} Di Left of dividend.
 * @param {Number} Dj Right of dividend.
 * @param {Array} d Divisor array.
 * @param {Number} di Left of divisor.
 * @param {Number} dj Right of divisor.
 * @param {Array} Q Quotient array.
 * @param {Number} Qi Left of quotient.
 * @param {Number} Qj Right of quotient.
 * @param {Array} R Remainder array.
 * @param {Number} Ri Left of remainder.
 * @param {Number} Rj Right of remainder.
 */
export default function _divmod(r, D, Di, Dj, d, di, dj, Q, Qi, Qj, R, Ri, Rj) {
	_copy(D, Di, Dj, R, Rj - (Dj - Di));

	_idivmod(r, R, Ri, Rj, d, di, dj, Q, Qi, Qj);
}

name: _divmod
description:
Computes the quotient and remainder of two numbers. Uses the most
appropriate algorithms depending on the size of the operands. The remainder
is written to the dividend array. There are a few assumptions made on the
input.

Input
-----
 - No leading zeros in D or Q.
 - |D| = |Q| = |R|

name: src/api/arithmetic/div/_idivmod.js
_idivmod
description:
Computes the quotient and remainder of two numbers. Uses the most
appropriate algorithm depending on the size of the operands. The remainder
is written to the dividend array. There are a few assumptions made on the
input.

Input
-----
 - |d| >= 1
 - |D| = |Q| >= 1
 - No leading zeros in D or d.
 - Q is zero initialized.

name: src/api/arithmetic/div/_imod.js
_imod
description:
Computes the remainder of two numbers. Uses the most
appropriate algorithm depending on the size of the operands. The remainder
is written to the dividend array. There are a few assumptions made on the
input.

Input
-----
 - |d| >= 1
 - |D| = |_| >= 1
 - No leading zeros in D or d.

name: src/api/arithmetic/mul/mul.js
mul
description:
Multiplies two big endian arrays and puts result in a destination array.

 Constraints:
 - C is zero initialized,
 - |A| >= 0,
 - |B| >= 0,
 - |C| >= |A| + |B|.

params.name: c
params.description: result, must be 0 initialized and be able to contain result

name: src/api/arithmetic/sub/decrement.js
decrement
description:
Subtracts 1 from a big endian array.

Wraps on underflow. Hence, does nothing if aj <= ai.

O(|A|) time in the worst case.
O(1) amortized time over any number of successive operations starting with A = O(1).
O(1) amortized time over O(|A|) successive operations starting with any A.

name: src/api/compare/cmp.js
content:
import _cmp from '../../core/compare/_cmp.js';

/**
 * Compares two big endian arrays with little constraints on the operands.
 *
 * Input:
 *   - |A| >= 0
 *   - |B| >= 0
 *
 * @param {number[]} a first operand
 * @param {number} ai a left
 * @param {number} aj a right
 * @param {number[]} b second operand
 * @param {number} bi b left
 * @param {number} bj b right
 *
 * @return {number} result 1 if a > b; 0 if a = b; -1 otherwise.
 */

export default function cmp(a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) {
	if (aj - ai < bj - bi) return -_cmp(b, bi, bj, a, ai, aj);
	return _cmp(a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj);
}

name: cmp
description:
Compares two big endian arrays with little constraints on the operands.

Input:
  - |A| >= 0
  - |B| >= 0

return.description: result 1 if a > b; 0 if a = b; -1 otherwise.

name: src/api/compare/eq.js
content:
import cmp from './cmp.js';

/**
 * Tests whether two big endian arrays are equal.
 *
 * Input:
 *   - |A| >= 0
 *   - |B| >= 0
 *
 * @param {number[]} a first operand
 * @param {number} ai a left
 * @param {number} aj a right
 * @param {number[]} b second operand
 * @param {number} bi b left
 * @param {number} bj b right
 *
 * @return {boolean} true iff A = B.
 */
const eq = (a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) => cmp(a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) === 0;
export default eq;

name: eq
description:
Tests whether two big endian arrays are equal.

Input:
  - |A| >= 0
  - |B| >= 0

name: src/api/compare/ge.js
content:
import cmp from './cmp.js';

/**
 * Compares two big endian arrays: returns true if the first is greater or
 * equal to the second.
 *
 * Input:
 *   - |A| >= 0
 *   - |B| >= 0
 *
 * @param {number[]} a first operand
 * @param {number} ai a left
 * @param {number} aj a right
 * @param {number[]} b second operand
 * @param {number} bi b left
 * @param {number} bj b right
 *
 * @return {boolean} true iff A >= B.
 */
const ge = (a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) => cmp(a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) >= 0;
export default ge;

name: ge
description:
Compares two big endian arrays: returns true if the first is greater or
equal to the second.

Input:
  - |A| >= 0
  - |B| >= 0

name: src/api/compare/gt.js
content:
import cmp from './cmp.js';

/**
 * Compares two big endian arrays: returns true if the first is greater than
 * the second.
 *
 * Input:
 *   - |A| >= 0
 *   - |B| >= 0
 *
 * @param {number[]} a first operand
 * @param {number} ai a left
 * @param {number} aj a right
 * @param {number[]} b second operand
 * @param {number} bi b left
 * @param {number} bj b right
 *
 * @return {boolean} true iff A > B.
 */
const gt = (a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) => cmp(a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) > 0;
export default gt;

name: gt
description:
Compares two big endian arrays: returns true if the first is greater than
the second.

Input:
  - |A| >= 0
  - |B| >= 0

name: src/api/compare/jz.js
jz
description:
Returns true if and only if input number A is 0.

Returns true if aj <= ai.
O(|A|) time in the worst case.
O(1) time if A has no leading zero.

return.description: true if and only if input number is 0.

name: src/api/compare/le.js
content:
import cmp from './cmp.js';

/**
 * Compares two big endian arrays: returns true if the first is less or equal
 * to the second.
 *
 * Input:
 *   - |A| >= 0
 *   - |B| >= 0
 *
 * @param {number[]} a first operand
 * @param {number} ai a left
 * @param {number} aj a right
 * @param {number[]} b second operand
 * @param {number} bi b left
 * @param {number} bj b right
 *
 * @return {boolean} true iff A <= B.
 */
const le = (a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) => cmp(a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) <= 0;
export default le;

name: le
description:
Compares two big endian arrays: returns true if the first is less or equal
to the second.

Input:
  - |A| >= 0
  - |B| >= 0

name: src/api/compare/lt.js
content:
import cmp from './cmp.js';

/**
 * Compares two big endian arrays: returns true if the first is less than
 * the second.
 *
 * Input:
 *   - |A| >= 0
 *   - |B| >= 0
 *
 * @param {number[]} a first operand
 * @param {number} ai a left
 * @param {number} aj a right
 * @param {number[]} b second operand
 * @param {number} bi b left
 * @param {number} bj b right
 *
 * @return {boolean} true iff A < B.
 */
const lt = (a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) => cmp(a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) < 0;
export default lt;

name: lt
description:
Compares two big endian arrays: returns true if the first is less than
the second.

Input:
  - |A| >= 0
  - |B| >= 0

name: src/api/compare/ne.js
content:
import cmp from './cmp.js';

/**
 * Tests whether two big endian arrays are not equal.
 *
 * Input:
 *   - |A| >= 0
 *   - |B| >= 0
 *
 * @param {number[]} a first operand
 * @param {number} ai a left
 * @param {number} aj a right
 * @param {number[]} b second operand
 * @param {number} bi b left
 * @param {number} bj b right
 *
 * @return {boolean} true iff A != B.
 */
const ne = (a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) => cmp(a, ai, aj, b, bi, bj) !== 0;
export default ne;

name: ne
description:
Tests whether two big endian arrays are not equal.

Input:
  - |A| >= 0
  - |B| >= 0

name: src/api/convert/convert.js
convert

Converts the input number A represented in base f to a number B represented
in base t. If A is 0 the output is B = [0], otherwise all leading zeros are
trimmed.

params.description: start offset in the origin array

params.name: aj
params.description: end offset in the origin array

name: src/api/convert/parse.js
parse

name: src/api/convert/stringify.js
stringify

params.name: aj
params.description: non-inclusive right bound of the input

name: src/api/convert/translate.js
translate
description:
Converts a string representation in base f to a string representation in
base t.

name: src/core/arithmetic/add/_add.js
_add
description:
Adds two big endian arrays and puts result in a destination array.
Wraps on overflow. |C| >= |A| >= |B|.

name: src/core/arithmetic/add/_iadd.js
_iadd
description:
Adds a big endian array to another.
Wraps on overflow. |A| >= |B|.

name: src/core/arithmetic/add/_iadd_limb.js
_iadd_limb
description:
Adds single limb to a big endian array.
Wraps on overflow.

Input:
  - |A| >= 1.

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_div_limb_with_prefix.js
_div_limb_with_prefix
description:
Divides a big endian number by a single limb number.
Can only work with limbs of size at most sqrt( 2^53 ).
Allows to prefix the dividend with an intermediate remainder.

Does not update the remainder.

Input
-----
 - 0 <= tmp <= d - 1
 - 1 <= d <= r - 1
 - |Q| = |D|

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_dc.js
_idivmod_dc
description:
Input
-----
 - No leading zeros
 - |A| = |C|
 - C must be zero-initialized.

References
----------
  - https://gmplib.org/manual/Divide-and-Conquer-Division.html

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_dc_21.js
_idivmod_dc_21
description:
Algorithm 3.3 Divide-and-conquer division (2 by 1)
==================================================

Input
-----
 Two nonnegative integers A and B,
 such that A < ^n B and ^n / 2  B < ^n.
 n must be even if n >= THRESHOLD_DIV_DC.

                   -----------                 -----
                  |  :  |  :  |               |  :  |
                   -----------                 -----

Output
------
 The quotient floor( A/B ) and the remainder A mod B.

Complexity
----------
 T(n) = 2T'(n/2) + K

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_dc_32.js
_idivmod_dc_32
description:
Algorithm 3.4 Divide-and-conquer division (3 by 2)
==================================================

Input
-----
 Two nonnegative integers A and B,
 such that A < ^n B and ^{2n} / 2  B < ^{2n}.
 n must be even.

                   --------                 -----
                  |  |  |  |               |  |  |
                   --------                 -----

Output
------
 The quotient floor( A/B ) and the remainder A mod B.

Complexity
----------
 T'(n)  T(n) + M(n) + Ln

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_limb.js
_idivmod_limb
description:
Divides a big endian number by a single limb number.
Can only work with limbs of size at most sqrt( 2^53 ).

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_limb_with_prefix.js
_idivmod_limb_with_prefix
description:
Divides a big endian number by a single limb number.
Can only work with limbs of size at most sqrt( 2^53 ).
Allows to prefix the dividend with an intermediate remainder.

Input
-----
 - |Q| = |D| >= 1.
 - NO NEED to reset Q. The loop will set every member of Q.

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_schoolbook.js
_idivmod_schoolbook
description:
Computes q <- a / b and a <- a % b.
No leading zeros allowed.
q has length at least aj - ai

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_schoolbook_large_divisor.js
_idivmod_schoolbook_large_divisor
description:
Input
-----
 - Two integers A and B such that r^(m-1) <= A < r^m and (r^n)/2 <= B < r^(n).
 - No leading zeros (ONLY IN B?)
 - Q is initialized with some limbs.

Output
-----
 The quotient floor( A/B ) and the remainder A mod B.

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_schoolbook_subroutine.js
_idivmod_schoolbook_subroutine
description:
Input
-----
 - Two integers A and B such that 0 <= A < ^(n+1) and (^n)/2 <= B < ^n.
 - |A| = |B| + 1
 - |Q| = |A|

Output
-----
 The quotient floor( A/B ) and the remainder A mod B.

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_schoolbook_subroutine_do.js
_idivmod_schoolbook_subroutine_do
description:
Input
-----
 - Two integers A and B such that 0 <= A < B *  and (^n)/2 <= B < ^n.
   (Hence B >= 1).
 - |A| = |B| + 1
 - |Q| = |A|

Output
-----
 The quotient floor( A/B ) and the remainder A mod B.

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_idivmod_slow.js
_idivmod_slow
description:
Computes quotient and remainder of two big endian arrays.

Computes quotient and remainder of two big endian arrays using long division algorithm (the one teached in european primary schools). /!\ This algorithm modifies its first operand. HYP : q is at least as large as r b is not zero

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_imod_limb.js
_imod_limb
description:
Divides a big endian number by a single limb number and writes the
remainder to the dividend array.

Computes a <- a % b.
Only works with limbs of size at most sqrt( 2^53 ).

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_imod_schoolbook.js
_imod_schoolbook
description:
Divides a big endian number by another big endian number and writes the
remainder to the dividend array.

Computes a <- a % b.
No leading zeros allowed.

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_imod_schoolbook_large_divisor.js
_imod_schoolbook_large_divisor
description:
Input
-----
 - Two integers A and B such that r^(m-1) <= A < r^m and (r^n)/2 <= B < r^(n).
 - No leading zeros (ONLY IN B?)

Output
-----
 The remainder A mod B.

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_imod_schoolbook_subroutine.js
_imod_schoolbook_subroutine
description:
Input
-----
 - Two integers A and B such that 0 <= A < ^(n+1) and (^n)/2 <= B < ^n.
 - |A| = |B| + 1

Output
-----
 The remainder A mod B.

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_imod_schoolbook_subroutine_do.js
_imod_schoolbook_subroutine_do
description:
Input
-----
 - Two integers A and B such that 0 <= A < B *  and (^n)/2 <= B < ^n.
   (Hence B >= 1).
 - |A| = |B| + 1

Output
-----
 The remainder A mod B.

name: src/core/arithmetic/div/_mod_limb.js
_mod_limb
description:
Divides a big endian number by a single limb number and returns only the
remainder.

Only works with limbs of size at most sqrt( 2^53 ).

name: src/core/arithmetic/gcd/_euclidean_algorithm_loop.js
_euclidean_algorithm_loop
description:
Euclidean algorithm. Computes the gcd of the two input numbers A and B,
A >= B. Input arrays are modified ___in-place___.

Input
-----

  - A >= B
  - No leading zeros

unknown.tagValue:
{Array} The array containing the gcd of A and B (one of A and B).
Return as [ d , di , dj ], where d is the array and di and dj are its left
and right bounds.

return.description:
The array containing the gcd of A and B (one of A and B).
Return as [ d , di , dj ], where d is the array and di and dj are its left
and right bounds.

name: src/core/arithmetic/gcd/_extended_euclidean_algorithm.js
_extended_euclidean_algorithm
description:
Precondition:
  - A >= B
  - No leading zeroes.

name: src/core/arithmetic/gcd/_extended_euclidean_algorithm_allocate.js
src/core/arithmetic/gcd/_extended_euclidean_algorithm_loop.js
_extended_euclidean_algorithm_loop
description: Extended Euclidean algorithm.
see:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extended_Euclidean_algorithm

Given two input integers a and b, a > b.
Let r_0 = a, r_1 = b,
    s_0 = 1, s_1 = 0,
    t_0 = 0, t_1 = 1 (Fibonacci :winkemoji:).

Let r_{i+1} = r_{i-1} % r_i             (division remainder)
Let q_i = (r_{i-1} - r_{i+1}) / r_i > 0 (division quotient)

An alternative definition is
r_{i+1} = r_{i-1} - q_i r_i       (with 0 <= r_{i+1} < r_i)

Then define
s_{i+1} = s_{i-1} - q_i s_i
t_{i+1} = t_{i-1} - q_i t_i

Let k be such that r_i > 0 for all i <= k and r_{k+1} = 0.

Since q_i > 0, if t_{i-1} > 0 and t_i < 0 then t_{i+1} > 0. On the other
hand, if t_{i-1} < 0 and t_i > 0 then t_{i+1} < 0. Note that t_2 < 0, so the
signs of the t_i alternate: t_0 = 0, t_1 = 1, t_2 < 0, t_3 > 0, t_4 < 0, t_5
> 0, etc. The pattern for t is 0, 1, -, +, -, +, -, etc.

The same holds for the s_i with flipped signs: note that s_2 = 1, then
s_0 = 1, s_1 = 0, s_2 = 1, s_3 < 0, s_4 > 0, s_5 < 0, etc.
The pattern for s is 1, 0, 1, -, +, -, +, etc.

  | 0  1  2  3  4  5  6
------------------------
s | 1  0  1  -  +  -  +
t | 0  1  -  +  -  +  -

With i >= 1, |t_{i+1}| >= |t_i| + |t_{i-1}| > |t_i| because q_i >= 1 and
|t_i| > 0 and, since the signs are alternating, we have |t_{i-1} - q_i t_i|
= |t_{i-1}| + |q_i t_i|. Same goes for s_{i+1} w.r.t s_i and s_{i-1}.


Input
-----
 - No leading zeroes
 - R0 >= R1
 - (two bullets above imply |R1| >= |R0|)
 - More at _extended_euclidean_algorithm_allocate.


Implementation details
----------------------

Here the implementation avoids computing with negative numbers and will only
output the absolute value of s_{i} and t_{i}. The signs can be recovered
from the number of steps of the algorithm.

Note that s_i <= b and t_i <= a (proof?). Equality holds
when i = k+1 and a and b are coprime. Thus s_i can sit in an array as large
as b and same for t_i and a.

Output
------

 Calling this function returns the number of steps that were executed.

name: src/core/arithmetic/mul/_imul_limb.js
_imul_limb
description:
Multiply b by x where x is a single limb.

Also works when x === r (by accident, needed for extensive test of
_convert_dc). In that case we check that r*(r-1) <= 2^53 - 1.
Maximum possible value for this to work is r = 94906266.

TODO define constant. Reuse elsewhere?

name: src/core/arithmetic/mul/_karatsuba.js
_karatsuba
description:
Multiply two big endian arrays using karatsuba algorithm,
|A| >= |B| >= 1, |C| >= |A| + |B|, |A| >= 2.

/!\ BLOCK MULTIPLICATION RESULT MUST HOLD IN THE JAVASCRIPT NUMBER TYPE
    (DOUBLE i.e. 53 bits)

EXPLANATION
###########

We consider the numbers a and b, both of size N = 2n.

We divide a and b into their lower and upper parts.

a = a1 r^{n} + a0 (1)
b = b1 r^{n} + b0 (2)

We express the product of a and b using their lower and upper parts.

a b = (a1 r^{n} + a0) (b1 r^{n} + b0) (3)
    = a1 b1 r^{2n} + (a1 b0 + a0 b1) r^{n} + a0 b0 (4)

This gives us 4 multiplications with operands of size n.
Using a simple trick, we can reduce this computation to 3 multiplications.

We give the 3 terms of (4) the names z0, z1 and z2.

z2 = a1 b1
z1 = a1 b0 + a0 b1
z0 = a0 b0

a b  = z2 r^{2n} + z1 r^{n} + z0

We then express z1 using z0, z2 and one additional multiplication.

(a1 + a0)(b1 + b0) = a1 b1 + a0 b0 + (a1 b0 + a0 b1)
                   = z2 + z0 + z1

z1 = (a1 + a0)(b1 + b0) - z2 - z0

AN ANOTHER WAY AROUND (not used here)

(a1 - a0)(b1 - b0) = (a1 b1 + a0 b0) - (a1 b0 + a0 b1)
(a0 - a1)(b1 - b0) = (a1 b0 + a0 b1) - (a1 b1 + a0 b0)
a b = (r^{2n} + r^{n})a1 b1 + r^{n}(a0 - a1)(b1 - b0) + (r^{n} + 1)a0 b0

This algorithm is a specific case of the Toom-Cook algorithm, when m = n =
2.

For further reference, see
 - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karatsuba_algorithm
 - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ToomCook_multiplication

name: src/core/arithmetic/mul/_karatsuba_right_op_is_small.js
_karatsuba_right_op_is_small
description:
Multiply two big endian arrays using karatsuba algorithm,
WHEN THE SECOND OPERAND IS SMALL.
|A| >= |B| >= 1, |C| >= |A| + |B|, |A| >= 2, Math.ceil(|A|/2) >= |B|.

/!\ BLOCK MULTIPLICATION RESULT MUST HOLD IN THE JAVASCRIPT NUMBER TYPE
    (DOUBLE i.e. 53 bits)

EXPLANATION
###########

We consider the numbers a and b0. a has size N = 2n, and b0 has size n.

We divide a into its lower and upper parts.

a = a1 r^{n} + a0 (1)

We express the product of a and b0 using these.

a b0 = (a1 r^{n} + a0) b0 (3)
     = a1 b0 r^{n} + a0 b0 (4)

This gives us 2 multiplications with operands of size n.

name: src/core/arithmetic/mul/_mul.js
_mul
description:
Computes C = A+B.

Constraints:
  - C is zero initialized,
  - |A| >= |B| >= 0,
  - |C| >= |A| + |B|.

TODO:
  - Use schoolbook mul if n = O(log m).

params.name: b
params.description: second operand, cannot have more limbs than A

params.name: c
params.description: result, must be 0 initialized and be able to contain A+B

name: src/core/arithmetic/mul/_mul_limb.js
_mul_limb
description:
Compute x * b where x is a single limb.
0 <= x <= r-1
No restriction on operand sizes.

name: src/core/arithmetic/mul/_schoolbook_mul.js
_schoolbook_mul
description:
Computes the product of two big endian arrays using schoolbook
multiplication. |C| >= |A|+|B|.

TODO Can this be optimized if we know that |A| >= |B|?
Probably better to do many small passes rather than few large passes ?!
This is what this implementation achieves, although it returns correct
results even when |A| < |B|.

name: src/core/arithmetic/mul/_toom22.js
src/core/arithmetic/pow/_pow_double.js
_pow_double
description: Computes pow(a,x) = a^x using exponentiation by squaring. Writes result to output array. /!\ |A| >= 1, |C| >= 1, |C| >= |A| * x, |C| = 000...0

name: src/core/arithmetic/pow/_pow_double_recursive.js
_pow_double_recursive
description: Computes pow(a,x) = a^x using exponentiation by squaring. Writes result to output array. /!\ |A| >= 1, |C| >= 1, |C| >= |A| * x, |C| = 000...0

name: src/core/arithmetic/sub/_isub.js
_isub
description:
Subtracts B from A, |A| >= |B|.
Wraps.

name: src/core/arithmetic/sub/_sub.js
_sub
description:
Subtracts two big endian arrays, |C| >= |A| >= |B|.
Wraps.

name: src/core/array/_alloc.js
_alloc
description: Allocate a new limb array.

params.name: n
params.description: The size of the array to allocate.

name: src/core/array/_build.js
src/core/array/_copy.js
_copy
description: Copy a limb array into another limb array.

name: src/core/array/_fill.js
_fill
description: Fill the input limb array with a fixed value.

params.name: v
params.description: the value used to fill the input array

name: src/core/array/_reset.js
_reset
description: Fill the input limb array with zeros.

name: src/core/array/_validate.js
src/core/array/_zeros.js
_zeros
description: Allocate a new limb array filled with zeros.

params.name: n
params.description: The size of the allocated array.

name: src/core/compare/_cmp.js
_cmp
description:
Compares two big endian arrays. The second operand cannot have more limbs
than the first.

Input:
  - |A| >= |B| >= 0

return.description: result 1 if a > b; 0 if a = b; -1 otherwise.

name: src/core/compare/_cmp_half.js
_cmp_half
description:
Compares a number A with size n = |A| to R = (r^n)/2.
When n=0, R=1/2, hence result is -1.

return.description: result 1 if A > R; 0 if a = R; -1 otherwise.

name: src/core/compare/_cmp_half_even_radix.js
src/core/compare/_cmp_half_odd_radix.js
src/core/compare/_cmp_n.js
_cmp_n
description:
Compares two big endian arrays.

Input:
  - |A| = |B|

return.description: 1 if a > b; 0 if a = b; -1 otherwise.

name: src/core/convert/_chr.js
_chr
description:
Converts a limb to a character representation. This only works if the limb
is at most 35.

name: src/core/convert/_convert.js
_convert
description:
Dispatcher for the various base conversion implementations.
The decision is based on the relation f <= t.

params.name: ai
params.description: start offset in the origin array

params.name: aj
params.description: end offset in the origin array

params.name: bi
params.description: start offset in the destination array

params.name: bj
params.description: end offset in the destination array

name: src/core/convert/_convert_dc.js
_convert_dc
description:
O(M(N) log N) where M(N) is multiplication time complexity.

  - bj - bi >= log_t(f) * ( aj - ai ) ;

Roughly, split number A into two halves A0 * f^l + A1. Convert A0 to B0 and
A1 to B1 recursively. Then multiply B0 by f^l in base t and finally add B1.

This implementation is not recursive. It is iterative, and will call a
simpler subroutine for the base case.

params.name: size_small_block
params.description: the size of a small block

the radix).

_trim_positive

Compute the new inclusive left bound of a limb array by skipping all
leading zeros.

return.description: The new inclusive left bound of the input.

name: src/core/convert/convert_keep_zeros.js
convert_keep_zeros
description:
Converts the input number A represented in base f to a number B represented
in base t. All leading zeros resulting from the conversion are kept.

params.name: ai
params.description: start offset in the origin array

params.name: aj
params.description: end offset in the origin array

name: src/core/convert/parse_keep_zeros.js
parse_keep_zeros
description:
Converts a string representation in base f to a limb array in base t keeping
all leading zeros resulting from the conversion process.

name: src/core/convert/trim_natural.js
trim_natural
description:
Trim a limb array so that it is either [0] or does not start with any
leading zeros. Return a newly allocated array and does not modify the input.

name: src/index.js

content: :elephant: [@aureooms/js-integer-big-endian](https://aureooms.github.io/js-integer-big-endian) == Arbitrary precision arithmetic for integers in big endian order. See [docs](https://aureooms.github.io/js-integer-big-endian). Twin project of [@aureooms/js-integer-little-endian](https://github.com/aureooms/js-integer-little-endian). ```js integer.parse( 16 , 100 , 'ff' ) ; // [ 2 , 55 ] integer.stringify( 100 , 16 , [ 2 , 55 ] ) ; // 'ff' integer.translate( 10 , 16 , '255' ) ; // 'ff' ``` [![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/aureooms/js-integer-big-endian.svg)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/aureooms/js-integer-big-endian/main/LICENSE) content: # Overview

name: ./doc/manual/installation.md
content:
# Installation
Can be managed using
[jspm](http://jspm.io)
or [npm](https://github.com/npm/npm).

### jspm
```terminal
jspm install npm:@aureooms/js-integer-big-endian
```

### npm
```terminal
npm install @aureooms/js-integer-big-endian --save
```
